intro: Viola × prutensis, commonly known as the Prut Valley violet, is a hybrid species native to the Prut River valley in Romania. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm. The plant features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are violet-blue, with five petals and a distinctive yellow beard at the base of the petals. Viola × prutensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
